bookCover.coverDescription: An interactive book on "Subtraction" for grade - 1

params.text: Subtraction

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
To subtract means to take away from a group or a number of things. 

When we subtract, the number of things in the group reduce or become less.

Example:

There were 5 eggs on the plate, if you take away 3 eggs, now we have only 2 eggs on the plate.
We can write this as: 5 - 3 = 2
More example

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: There were 6 balls, 3 balls were lost, now we only have 3 balls remaining.
We can write this as 6 - 3 = 3
Subtraction equation

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
The biggest number is the minuend.

The number which we are taking away is called subtrahend.

The result of the subtraction is called difference.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.alt: Subtraction of one and two digit numbers

params.text: Subtraction of one digit numbers
Subtraction of two digit numbers
Subtract 34 from 65

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
Subtract ones and write in the ones place.

5 ones – 4 ones = 1 ones

Subtract tens and write in the tens place.

6 tens – 3 tens = 3 tens

params.textField:
We subtract from ones place with *ones place* digit and tens place with *tens place* digit.

Example: 
25 - 11 = *14*
Here, 2 - 1 = *1*  and  5 - 1 = *4*

metadata.title: Q4. Drag the words into the correct boxes
Subtraction of one and two digit numbers

params.text: Number line

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
Subtraction on a number line helps to subtract smaller numbers very easily.

While subtracting numbers on a number line, we need to jump (move) towards the left-hand side of a number line.
Steps to follow

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
Example:

Subtract 9 by 2

  • Step 1: Mark the minuend (9) on the number line.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Step 2: Move towards the left-hand side of the number line according to the number given in the subtrahend. In this case, the subtrahend is 2, so we will move 2 units to the left as shown by the arrows. Hence, we land on 7, which is the answer.
We can write this as: 9 - 2 = 7
More example

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
Subtract 3 from 8

Move 3 units from 8 to left
We get, 8 - 3 = 5

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Word problems

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: #1. Tom has 6 apples. Out of them 3 apples are rotten. How many apples are good?

Tom had 6 apples, 3 of them were rotten.

So, Good apples left = 6 - 3 = 3 apples

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: #2 Tina had 3 candies, she ate 2 of them. How many candies does she have left?

Tina had 3 candies, she ate 2 of them.

So, Candies left = 3 - 2 = 1 candy

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: #3 Albert had $50, he spent $30 on a football. How much money does he have left?

Albert had $50, he spent $30 on a football.

So, Money left = $50 - $30 = $20

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

-
